resources.string: App icon of an installed app
Like our app? Then rate it!
You must type some feedback to proceed!
Step 2: Select app to send feedback
[Placeholder notification] Enabling auto-dismiss setting for this may cause the notification to be removed from your Fitbit device as well
Get all your notifications on your Fitbit device
This app is designed for use with the Fitbit platform. It requires the official Fitbit app, and is compatible with most Fitbit devices. We are not affiliated with Fitbit, Inc.
You must enable notification access for this app and the official Fitbit app. Click the button below, and then enable access for both apps in the next screen.
Nice, We now have notification access! Let\'s move on to the next step.
Great, you already enabled notification access!
This app requires notification access to work. And looks like you have already enabled it! Move on to the next step!
Looks like you don\'t have the official Fitbit app installed. We\'ll need that, so let\'s install it by clicking the button below.
Setup notifications in Fitbit app: Step 1
Setup notifications in Fitbit app: Step 2
Setup notifications in Fitbit app: Step 3

First, go into device settings by clicking the device icon in the Fitbit app. 

Compatible Fitbit devices:
Fitbit Alta, Alta HR, Charge 2, Charge 3, Blaze, Surge, Ionic, Versa, and any future device that supports "Text Notifications". Limited compatibility with Fitbit Flex 2 (lights up the LEDs).

Looks like you already finished setup once. \n\nIf you are still having issues with notifications, try rebooting the phone and setup again. You can also go through the troubleshooting section of this app for help and useful resources.
Select \'Notifications\' option under \'General\'. Then, Select \'Text Messages\' option.

Choose \'Fit Notifications\' app as your default messaging app. Then, sync your Fitbit device within the Fitbit app. Do not choose this app for the \'Call\' and \'Calendar Events\' options, otherwise you MAY NOT get any notifications. \n\nYou can also enable the \'Always Vibrate\' option in this setting page in the Fitbit app, if you plan to use \'Do Not Disturb\' or \'Silent\' mode.
Fitbit app not found! Go back and install the official Fitbit app!

You can now choose the apps whose notifications you want to receive on your Fitbit device. They will appear like Text Notifications on the device and will have the app name for clarity. \n\nYou can also configure additional settings using the gear icon (settings icon) for each app individually.
This service will try to stay in the background. If you stop receiving notifications, restart the service from this app. Don\'t use task killer apps, as they can disable the service.
Do not disturb mode on Android 6.0+

If you enable do not disturb mode, then no notifications will be forwarded to your Fitbit device, by default. To change that, you need to follow specific instructions by clicking below. \n\nYou should also enable the \'Always Vibrate\' option in the Fitbit app\'s notifications settings page.
Extra Instructions for Android 8 and above

Click on configure below. In the next screen, choose \"Notifications\" and enable \"Treat as priority\".\n \nNow, when you use silent mode, enable \"Priority Only\". Doing so will allow you to get notifications via the app on your Fitbit device, but it will not make any notification sound on the phone as this app doesn\'t cause notification sounds or vibrations anyway.

Click on configure below. In the next screen, choose \"Notifications\". Then, disable \"Show silently\" setting and enable \"Override Do Not Disturb\".\n \nNow, when you use silent mode, enable \"Priority Only\". Doing so will allow you to get notifications via the app on your Fitbit device, but it will not make any notification sound on the phone as this app doesn\'t cause notification sounds or vibrations anyway.

Click on configure below. In the next screen, choose "App notifications". Select the "Placeholder notification" category and enable "Override Do Not Disturb".
 
Now, when you use silent mode, enable "Priority Only". Doing so will allow you to get notifications via the app on your Fitbit device.
 
Note: You can configure other options in Android Oreo to make the notifications flexible. But, DON'T reduce the Importance of the notification to "Low" as that will disable notification forwarding to your Fitbit device!
Click the button below to send a test notification. You will see it on your device if the setup was successful! That\'s the basics! Check out the settings page for additional features!
Setup is incomplete! Please review the interactive setup once, even if you successfully configured a previous version of the app.
Okay, you can check out the new setup process at any time!
This is the placeholder notification channel for the Fit Notifications app. These notifications are essential for the proper functioning of the app.
Automatically dismiss relayed notifications from other apps
Set number of notifications each app can send to your Fitbit device.\n\nUse this if you receive too many notifications on your device in a short duration.
All notifications are sent as they arrive, without limitation.

plurals.name: notif_limit_duration_summary
plurals.item: One notification relayed every %1$d second for each enabled app. Additional notifications are discarded.
One notification relayed every %1$d seconds for each enabled app. Additional notifications are discarded.

resources.string: When enabled, forward notifications for only "Priority mode" apps in "Do Not Disturb" mode. (You must enable "Override Do Not Disturb" setting for this app and the Priority mode apps)
Send notifications to Fitbit device even if screen is on
Do not send notifications to Fitbit device if screen is on
App name is displayed in notification sent to Fitbit tracker
App name is not displayed in notification sent to Fitbit tracker
Non-Latin characters will be converted to Latin
Non-Latin characters will not be transliterated
Split long notifications into smaller ones to display on your Fitbit device without truncation
No apps fit your search criteria.
Separate multiple patterns with a semicolon (;). Filters can either be exclusive or inclusive. Only notifications that satisfy the filters will be allowed. Click the info button for more details.

You can set both positive and negative filters. To create a positive filter, start the text with a plus (+) sign. So, if you want to only forward notifications containing the word 'John', then your filter text should be '+John' (without the quotes ' ').

 To create a negative filter, start the text with a minus (-) sign. So, if you don't want to forward notifications containing the word 'Smith', then create a filter with the text '-Smith'.

 For backwards compatibility, any filter that does not contain a '+' or '-' sign at the start is treated as a negative filter.

 NOTE: To filter a plus sign at the start of your positive filter do the following: '++John'. This will forward only those notifications that contain the phrase '+John'.
Notifications from this app will only be forwarded to your Fitbit from the specified start time till the specified end time.
Start time cannot be the same as the end time
End time cannot be the same as the start time

Fit Notifications is a third party application that allows you to send notifications from any of the apps installed on your phone to your compatible Fitbit device. In order to properly setup this application, please follow the provided instructions. Please note that this app will not work if the Fitbit app\'s notifications feature is not compatible with your phone.

The source code for this app is available at Github (abhijitvalluri/fitnotifications), with contributions from other developers apart from Smart Dinosaurs Entertainment.

Please note that neither \'Fit Notifications\' nor \'Smart Dinosaurs Entertainment\' is affiliated with Fitbit, Inc. in anyway.

Disclaimer

Fitbit is a registered trademark and service mark of Fitbit, Inc. \'Fit Notifications\' is designed for use with the Fitbit platform. This application is not developed by Fitbit, and Fitbit does not service or warrant the functionality of this application.

To properly set up this application, please follow the instructions below:

  1. Enable notification access to this application by clicking the \'Enable Notification Access\' button on the main screen.

  2. In the Fitbit app, go into your device settings by clicking the device icon*.

  3. Select \'Text Notifications\' or \'Call and Text Notifications\' under \'General\'.

  4. Select \'Text Notifications\' under \'Settings\'.

  5. Choose \'Fit Notifications\'. Sync your Fitbit device within the Fitbit app.

    6. NOTE: Do not choose \'Fit Notifications\' for \'Call Notifications\' or \'Calendar Notifications\' in the Fitbit app! Doing so will cause this app to not work!

  6. In the \'Fit Notifications\' app, press the \'Setup Apps\' button on the main screen. Then, choose the apps whose notifications you would like to be sent to your compatible Fitbit device.

  7. Click the \'Turn on\' button at the bottom of the main screen when you want to start the notification service provided by this app. Once the service is running, the button says \'Turn off\' to stop the service. Click the \'Turn off\' button to stop the service. You must keep the Fitbit app from Fitbit, Inc. installed at all times and pair your Fitbit device to the phone for this to work. Enjoy!

  8. NOTE: If you use a device running Android 6.0 or above and you enable \"Do Not Disturb\" mode, also called silent mode, then please follow the additional instructions below.

* You must have a compatible Fitbit device, such as Fitbit Alta, Alta HR, Charge 2, Blaze or Surge.

Future updates will further refine the feature set of this app! Please provide feedback on Google Play if there are any issues and if you like this app, kindly provide or update your review!

Enabling notifications when using \"Do Not Disturb\" mode

Due to the new \"Do Not Disturb\" mode in Android 6.0, if you use this mode (also called silent mode) then you will not receive notifications on your Fitbit device as Android disables notification forwarding. To avoid this issue manually, you have to change the notifications priority for Fit Notifications app.

To do so, go to \"Settings>Apps>Fit Notifications\". Note that this menu may be at a slightly different location on your phone. Then, choose \"Notifications\" and enable \"Treat as priority\". Note that if your phone is running Android 7.0 (Nougat) or newer version, then the option is renamed to \"Override Do Not Disturb\". Enable this option. Then, when you use silent mode, enable \"Priority Only\". Doing so will allow you to get notifications via the app on your Fitbit device, but it will not make any notification sound on the phone as this app doesn\'t cause notification sounds or vibrations anyway.

Demo

Once you finish the setup process, press the \'Test Notification\' button on the main screen to send a test notification to your Fibit. You should then see a notification in the status bar from this app, while at the same time you should have received a sample notification on your Fitbit. Then, you have confirmed that the application is working correctly! Issues? Please contact us!

Q. Is my Fitbit device supported?

This app will work with any Fitbit device that supports text notifications. This includes Fitbit Alta, Alta HR, Blaze, Surge, Charge 2, Charge 3, Versa, Ionic and any future Fitbit models that support text notifications.

Please note that Fitbit, Inc. may modify the behavior of text notifications at any time for the compatible devices. This is not in our control.

Q. Where can I find useful information to troubleshoot issues with notifications?

You may find these help pages on the Fitbit website very useful in troubleshooting a variety of issues:

  • How do I get notifications from my phone on my Fitbit device?
  • My Fitbit device isn\'t receiving notifications from my phone
  • How do I restart my Fitbit device?

Q. What is the placeholder notification and why is it important?

The placeholder notification is crucial for the proper functioning of this app. For example, if you setup this app to forward notifications from your email app to your Fitbit device, then whenever you receive an email notification, this app creates a corresponding \"Placeholder notification\" which contains the relevant info from your email notification. It is this placeholder notification that is then sent to your Fitbit device, and you see the info contained in your email notification on your Fitbit device.

Note: If your Fitbit device allows you to dismiss the notification on the watch, then the placeholder notification will be dismissed on your phone as well. Similarly, if you dismiss the placeholder notification on your phone either manually, or by using the \"Dismiss placeholder notification\" feature from this app\'s settings, then the notification will get dismissed from your Fitbit device as well. So, please keep this in mind if you enable this setting in the app, as it can cause the notifications to be dismissed automatically after a delay on your Fitbit device as well!

Q. Why is my Fitbit device not vibrating when it receives a notification?

Please be aware that your Fitbit device may actually be receiving notifications, but may not be alerting you because it is not vibrating. This can happen in silent mode or do not disturb mode, or may occur on devices running Android 10 and above, because of the way Fit Notifications app creates a new, silent notification (placeholder notification).

To fix this problem, you can go to the \"Notifications\" settings for your Fitbit device in the official Fitbit app. In the Notifications settings, please enable the \"Always Vibrate\" option.

Q. I am not getting any notifications on my Fitbit device! How can I fix it?

Please ensure that your Fitbit device is one of the supported devices, as described above. Also, make sure that your phone is compatible with the \"Call & Text Notifications\" feature of the Fitbit app by checking on the Fitbit website. If your phone is not listed on the Fitbit website, or does not have the \"Call & Text Notifications\" feature listed as compatible, then this app may not work.

If your phone is compatible, then verify that you followed all the instructions in the setup, including enabling notification access to \"Fitbit Notifications\". Also, ensure that you can sync to your Fitbit device by enabling Bluetooth (location services should also be enabled on newer Android devices).

Q. I still cannot get notifications!! Why?

Make sure you have turned on your Fitbit device\'s notification setting. You can learn how to do this and many other helpful tips to troubleshoot issues by visiting this help page on the Fitbit website.

Some other suggestions for troubleshooting:

  • Ensure that the \"Fit Notifications\" service is running by pressing \"Turn on\" button on the home page. This service MAY get stopped by Android on occasion. Do not use task killers as they may accidentally stop this service and cause issues.
  • You can click on the \"Test Notification\" button on the home page to send a test notification and troubleshoot the functionality of this app.
  • Low battery on your Fitbit device: Please charge your device as the Fitbit app may disable Notifications if your Fitbit device has low battery.
  • Your Fitbit device may require a restart to enable notifications, due to errors. Please read this help page to learn how to restart your device.
  • You may need to go through the interactive setup process again and select \"Fit Notifications\" as your text notification app in Fitbit, and sync your device again.

Q. Are there any known issues with this app?

Some users have experienced issues receiving notifications when they enable the \"Dismiss placeholder notification\" setting within this app. If you are experiencing issues with notifications, please try increasing the \"Dismiss\" delay, or try disabling this setting completely. Also, refer to the above FAQ on \"placeholder notifications\" for more details about how some Fitbit devices deal with notifications being dismissed on the phone.

Q. Why am I not getting notifications from a particular app on my phone?

Go to the \"Setup Apps\" screen from the home page, and make sure that you have selected the app for which you want to see notifications. Click on the settings icon next to the checkbox to access the app specific settings, and check that all settings are correct, including the schedule. These app specific settings can cause some notifications to not appear, so it is important to verify them.

If you still have issues, and followed the instructions correctly, then please contact us via email to inform us the name of the application (including Google Play Store link) for which you are missing notifications. We will follow up to troubleshoot the issue with you.

Q. Will this app ever stop working as advertised?

If Fitbit, Inc. decides to change the behavior of text notifications from 3rd party apps such as this, then unfortunately \"Fit Notifications\" may stop working. We will try to update the app in case of such issues, but we cannot guarantee that this app will work forever. Please report such issues to us.

Q. Can this app function if I use task killers on my phone?

Please note that task killers may interfere with the proper functioning of this app. It is recommended that you disable task killers or at least allow them to keep the \"Fit Notifications\" service running.

Changes in version 2.11.1:

  • Updated app to support Android 11 platform, general stability improvements, bug fixes, and UI tweaks.

  • Updated placeholder notification message and added an FAQ entry to explain the importance of placeholder notifications, and clarify potential issues when using the \"Dismiss placeholder notification\" setting in the app.

  • Implemented a proper dark theme! Now the app should look even better when you use a system-wide dark/night theme!

  • Emergency update: Fixed a crash observed in the previous update (2.11.0) that occurs on older Android devices. This crash was due to the transliteration feature not initializing correctly on phones running Android 9 or lower.

Note: If your Fitbit device does not vibrate but still receives notifications, then try enabling the \"Always Vibrate\" setting in the Fitbit app, under the \"Notifications\" settings for your Fitbit device.

Support the developer! You can donate to the app developer by visiting the donation web page! More details on the website.

5. Time Zone Database

ICU uses the public domain data and code derived from Time Zone Database for its time zone support. The ownership of the TZ database is explained in BCP 175: Procedure for Maintaining the Time Zone Database section 7.

# 7. Database Ownership
#
# The TZ database itself is not an IETF Contribution or an IETF
# document. Rather it is a pre-existing and regularly updated work
# that is in the public domain, and is intended to remain in the
# public domain. Therefore, BCPs 78 [RFC5378] and 79 [RFC3979] do
# not apply to the TZ Database or contributions that individuals make
# to it. Should any claims be made and substantiated against the TZ
# Database, the organization that is providing the IANA
# Considerations defined in this RFC, under the memorandum of
# understanding with the IETF, currently ICANN, may act in accordance
# with all competent court orders. No ownership claims will be made
# by ICANN or the IETF Trust on the database or the code. Any person
# making a contribution to the database or code waives all rights to
# future claims in that contribution or in the TZ Database.
